messageBody:
http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#tests_7

A fairly frequent question ;-)

fail() is one of the things in JUnit that I use most often

Try to test under a condition that provokes the exception, and a
different test that you expect to pass, for starters.


On Thu, 17 Feb 2005 00:11:35 +0530, Anil Devrao J
<anildevrao.jadhav@...> wrote:
>
> Hi All,
>
> How to handle the following scenario. Suggestions will be mostly
> appreciated.
>
> Implementation Method:
>
> Boolean abcMethod() throws xException
> {
> bole retFlag = false;
> try{
> ________________;
> ________________;
> ________________;
> retFlag = true;
> }

> ____________;
>

>
